info.title: Docker Remote API
info.description: The API for each docker installation.

post.summary: Build an image from Dockerfile via stdin
post.description: Build an image from Dockerfile via stdin

parameters.name: forcerm
parameters.description: always remove intermediate containers (includes rm)Request Headers:

parameters.name: nocache
parameters.description: do not use the cache when building the image

parameters.name: pull
parameters.description: attempt to pull the image even if an older image exists locally

parameters.name: rm
parameters.description: remove intermediate containers after a successful build (default behavior)

parameters.name: t
parameters.description: repository name (and optionally a tag) to be applied to        the resulting image in case of success

post.summary: Create a new image from a container's changes
post.description: Create a new image from a container's changes

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Assign the specified name to the container. Must    match /?[a-zA-Z0-9_-]+.

parameters.name: all
parameters.description: 1/True/true or 0/False/false, Show all containers.        Only running containers are shown by default (i.e., this defaults to false)

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: Show only containers created before Id, include        non-running ones.

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description: a json encoded value of the filters (a map[string][]string) to process on the containers list. Available filters:

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Show limit last created        containers, include non-running ones.

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: Show only containers created since Id, include        non-running ones.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: 1/True/true or 0/False/false, Kill then remove the container.        Default false

parameters.name: v
parameters.description: 1/True/true or 0/False/false, Remove the volumes        associated to the container. Default false

parameters.name: stderr
parameters.description: 1/True/true or 0/False/false, if logs=true, return        stderr log, if stream=true, attach to stderr. Default false

parameters.name: stdin
parameters.description: 1/True/true or 0/False/false, if stream=true, attach        to stdin. Default false

parameters.name: stdout
parameters.description: 1/True/true or 0/False/false, if logs=true, return        stdout log, if stream=true, attach to stdout. Default false

500.description: server errornStream details:nWhen using the TTY setting is enabled innPOST /containers/createn,nthe stream is the raw data from the process PTY and client's stdin.nWhen the TTY is disabled, then the stream is multiplexed to separatenstdout and stderr.nThe format is a Header and a Payload (frame).nHEADERnThe header will contain the information on which stream write thenstream (stdout or stderr). It also contain the size of thenassociated frame encoded on the last 4 bytes (uint32).nIt is encoded on the first 8 bytes like this:nheader := [8]byte{STREAM_TYPE, 0, 0, 0, SIZE1, SIZE2, SIZE3, SIZE4}nnSTREAM_TYPE can be:

get.summary: Inspect changes on a container's filesystem
get.description: Inspect changes on a container's filesystem

post.summary: Copy files or folders from a container
post.description: Copy files or folders from a container

parameters.name: stderr
parameters.description: 1/True/true or 0/False/false, show stderr log. Default false

parameters.name: stdout
parameters.description: 1/True/true or 0/False/false, show stdout log. Default false

parameters.name: tail
parameters.description: Output specified number of lines at the end of logs: all or <number>. Default all

parameters.name: timestamps
parameters.description: 1/True/true or 0/False/false, print timestamps for        every log line. Default false

parameters.name: t
parameters.description: number of seconds to wait before killing the container

parameters.name: t
parameters.description: number of seconds to wait before killing the container

get.summary: List processes running inside a container
get.description: List processes running inside a container

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description: a json encoded value of the filters (a map[string][]string) to process on the event list. Available filters:

404.description: no such exec instancenStream details:nSimilar to the stream behavior of POST /container/(id)/attach API

parameters.name: fromImage
parameters.description: name of the image to pull

parameters.name: fromSrc
parameters.description: source to import.  The value may be a URL from which the image        can be retrieved or - to read the image from the request body.

parameters.name: registry
parameters.description: the registry to pull fromRequest Headers:

404.description: no such exec instancenStream details:nSimilar to the stream behavior of POST /container/(id)/attach API

get.summary: Get a tarball containing all images.
get.description: Get a tarball containing all images.

404.description: no such exec instancenStream details:nSimilar to the stream behavior of POST /container/(id)/attach API

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description: a json encoded value of the filters (a map[string][]string) to process on the images list. Available filters:

404.description: no such exec instancenStream details:nSimilar to the stream behavior of POST /container/(id)/attach API

post.summary: Load a tarball with a set of images and tags into docker
post.description: Load a tarball with a set of images and tags into docker

get.summary: Get a tarball containing all images in a repository
get.description: Get a tarball containing all images in a repository

get.summary: Get the history of an image
get.description: Get the history of an image

post.summary: Push an image on the registry
post.description: Push an image on the registry

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: the tag to associate with the image on the registry, optional

post.summary: Tag an image into a repository
post.description: Tag an image into a repository
